definitions.definition: any one of the eight least valuable pieces in the game of chess
a person who does not have any real power but is used by others to achieve something:
examples: The refugees are pawns in an international political dispute.

definitions.definition: to leave a possession with a pawnbroker, who gives you money for it and can sell it if the money is not paid back within a certain time:
examples: Of all items pawned, jewellery is the most common.
